website_summaries.verdict: An inexpensive pick perfect for leisurely kayakers looking for remarkable value.
pros: Grips on paddles spaced well and do not slide around when dry
Customers appreciate how the offered size works well with most individual's heights
Can easily come apart for simple storage
cons: Has a smaller shaft than other similar models

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a used kayak that came with this SeaSense X-treme II 96" paddle. I was quite happy with it. I have since purchased two more of them through Amazon and will be purchasing the 84" version in the near future. As others have said, this is a great paddle for the price. Be warned it does have a smaller diameter shaft than most other kayaks - the foam cushion does enlarge it some though - it may be a better fit for those with smaller hands than those with large hands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sea snese Xtreme kayak paddle
customer_reviews.text: There are better paddles, lighter paddles (but your going to pay a lot more for them) this one works great and the price is just right. I am 5'7 and the paddle length is perfect (84") even with the wide cockpit on my Vapor 10 angler.
customer_reviews.author: mark robinson

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: Pay for what you get I guess. I am using this paddle for sitting on my SUP. For anything or anyone else this 84” is too short. The shaft grip is too narrow and the blades are flimsy and not durable plastic. They could easily break. Fastened in place by a blind rivet. Don’t buy if you are even a little serious about kayaking. You’ll be up a creek without a paddle. I have purchased other paddles of quality construction for only slightly more money. Anything but extreme.
customer_reviews.author: Monkle124

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size for Average Sized Adult 5'9" 150lbs
customer_reviews.text: I am 5'9" 150lbs and this is the perfect size for me and my kayak. I run a perception sound which has a wider cockpit than most sit in kayaks. I have also used this in a more narrow dagger zydeco and it works even better in that setup. This gives me the reach I need to make strong paddles without having to raise it vertical which keeps water out of my kayak. I honestly dont know how they make and ship these for the price but I am glad I got one. My smaller paddles will be used for kids or as backups, this is my go to!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: For the price its good. The grips on mine did move
customer_reviews.text: For the price its good. The grips on mine did move, even though others said theirs didnt. Some electrical tape and adhesive will stop that. The blades feel flimsy, and dont trust them for pushing off or banging into rocks/etc. I could spend a few hundred, or thousand on a great paddle, but I dont need something that solid at this point in my paddling career. Better than a entry level $20 paddle by far, but definitely not something Id take into the backwoods as my only paddle for a 2 week trip. Great for small lakes and streams where integrity is not an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ohio Potter

customer_reviews.title: Great paddles
customer_reviews.text: So far I am really happy with this paddle. It fits me well, is light weight, and after using it for the summer I have had no issues with it. The blades don't feel like the most sturdy but I have been able to push off with them and have not had any issues with cracking or breaking, however I am cautious when I do this. The drip guards keep your hands dry, and even if your hands get wet the grip pads make it easy to keep hold. The fact that this paddle floats is also a plus in case you don't have a paddle leash or if it comes loose.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Your next paddle is right here!!
customer_reviews.text: Love this paddle! It handles awesome in every conditions we have been in, from all day trips and canyoning, to crazy storms, to the relaxing sunset rides, this paddle is all about comfort, durability, style and beauty!
customer_reviews.author: Brad Cole

customer_reviews.title: Love this Paddle!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this paddle, finally invested and bought a kayak instead of always renting so I wasn't sure what to get. This breaks down so easily and is strong enough to use to push off of the shore if need be. Beautiful colors and light enough to wear my 5 year old can take a turn paddling and actually get us somewhere. not disappointed at all. I'm 5'1" and everyone kept telling me I needed something shorter. not at all! glad I didn't listen.
customer_reviews.author: Mac McMullen

customer_reviews.title: and it was awesome for that
customer_reviews.text: I really bought this as a cheap way to test a 240cm paddle length,and it was awesome for that. The paddle works great. The plastic end have a lot of flex which give it a bit of whip, but I fear breaking them when jamming them into rocks to get unstuck. I would not be comfortable having this as my only paddle on a long trip, but with my spare it works well enough for now. Totally worth the price. Could not decide between 3 and 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Davolous

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality paddle, being new to kayaking I didn't know some of the things to look for, but I'm glad this paddle has them, the padded grips are a nice touch as well as the drip guards at the end of the paddle keep you from getting so much water on you or in the boat.
customer_reviews.author: Rottie fan 77

customer_reviews.title: Good Paddle for the money, issues a year later
customer_reviews.text: I needed a spare paddle that was better than the cheap one that came with my kayak, but not as expensive as my really good paddle. Good paddle for light river or flat water, with little to no waves. 11 months later, 1st use this summer, the metal has expanded/shrank where they connect together. I cannot get it to go together or separate correctly. My husband is going to try and fix it. I hope he can.
customer_reviews.author: knamp

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a spare paddle to keep with a spare kayak. Used it on the river the other day, and the only thing I could find to complain about it is that the shaft is a smaller diameter than most paddles. Other than that, for less than $35, it was light enough, strong enough, and performed perfectly. Our other, "usual" paddles are mid-shelf...they're lighter, stouter feeling, and have a standard diameter shaft, but they also cost 3X what this one did. Wouldn't recommend it as a primary, but it's perfect as a spare or a back up.
customer_reviews.author: Clayne T. Bedsole

customer_reviews.title: Good quality addition to your kayaking experience.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these yak paddles as upgrades to some 84 inchers. What a huge difference these made. Lower angle of attack, not hitting the gunwalls as much, better turning-control, paddling upstream, paddling backwards, comfortable for usage on 4+ hour trips, included drip guards are nice as well. If you purchased a recreational type kayak, lifetime, dolphin, etc from a local store with included paddle for about 200, this is gonna be what makes your purchase a lot more enjoyable. Keep the old paddle as a back up / spare though..or decorative wall hanger. I would recommend this paddle without hesitation.
customer_reviews.author: WA DUDE

customer_reviews.title: Im 5"9 male and got the 96 inch. Feels ...
customer_reviews.text: Im 5"9 male and got the 96 inch. Feels alot nicer than the ones in the store and its half the price. It also has hand grips which is a plus. The drip catchers (or whatever you call them) actually stay in place and are solid- not the rubber flimsy plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Light and fast
customer_reviews.text: Way lighter than both my 84 in aluminum and fiberglass paddles. Able to maintain the same speed as my 84 in. paddle with about 65% - 70% of the effort. ( Arc length is about 14 % greater for same swept angle and area of a circle swept by the longer paddle is 30% larger, so go figure.) Another nice feature is that even though the handle is dark it remains much cooler in the sunlight than either of my other paddles. My wife tried it and made me buy her one.
customer_reviews.author: SA Mathman

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy but it gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: It's a paddle. It works. What else is there to say. I don't have a more expensive type paddle to compare this too, but it gets the job done. It detaches in the middle for easy storage.
customer_reviews.author: BobPT

customer_reviews.title: paddle is perfect for the price
customer_reviews.text: paddle is perfect for the price. I wish I had a little longer paddle since I am kayaking in the ocean and the waters are a little strong. I continuously have water dripping back on my feet and arms, but since I live in Charleston and it's usually 90-100 degrees here, it's pretty nice to have the water cool me off. Great starter paddle. Material is strong and metal clasp clicks and fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: qar01

customer_reviews.title: Nice low price paddle
customer_reviews.text: I was debating these for awhile because I wanted a nice paddle. I have went on hour long kayak trips with this paddle and I highly recommend it. It's a great price and I think compares to my $150 paddles that I got as a gift. Go with these over an expensive paddle in my opinion. I can't really say I prefer my expensive paddle over this one or vis versa. For casual kayaking trips on the lake (even lengthy ones) I think these are the best option.
customer_reviews.author: J123456789

customer_reviews.title: Functional
customer_reviews.text: It's okay. Seems a little bit questionable / flimsy but I guess it worked ok. I would probably have spent more if I did it again. Update: been using this for several outings now and it's held up well. And I do like that it comes apart easily for storage / portability. I would recommend it and purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: 1080p

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddle
customer_reviews.text: I bought this paddle to replace a paddle that came with a inexpensive kayak. The paddle that came with the kayak was horrible. This paddle is everything I needed! - I was worried about the length, im 5'8' and the width was very usefull. The grips did not slide. The drip rings helped keep the water off my legs and boat. I am not sure how the others are getting the paddle so wet that the foam cushions move. The paddle worked so well that my nephew is getting one for his kayak. It grabbed and moved me through the water with ease and speed. I highly recommend this paddle - esp for the cost!
customer_reviews.author: jonna vaughn

customer_reviews.title: Buy this instead of the store brand.
customer_reviews.text: I have kayaked for 20 years, I own 6 of them . The "store " paddles that come with the kayaks now a day are cheap and no hand padding. I replaced them all with these at a much cheaper price and a lighter , more comfortable paddles. Don't hesitate to buy these. Even the $200 carbon paddles don't have hand padding. ( that's the $350 model).
customer_reviews.author: John Vieau

customer_reviews.title: Nice Paddle
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my Lifetime Tamarak Kayak. I haven't even used the paddle that came with that Kayak, just went straight out and got this for it. I'm 5'8" and this seems to be about the right fit for the kayaka and my size. I little harder to put down on the kayak - I have the option of my lap or up under the front para-chord straps. Seems good quality and no issues that I've encountered.
customer_reviews.author: KalEl28

customer_reviews.title: SO much better than my previous paddle!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not a professional kayaker; just an occasional one. But even I know (from experience) that a reasonably priced, mid-level paddle is better than the garbage that came with my kayak. Please read reviews (here and on other sites, but Amazon is a good start). This paddle is a great new to mid-level paddle, and VERY reasonably priced! It hasn't "steered " me wrong. Sorry, I couldn't resist the pun! :-)
customer_reviews.author: GermanGoodness

customer_reviews.title: Great deep water paddle for the price
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised - nice light weight paddle, especially for the price. Hand grip padding is fantastic, but not sure how long that soft foam padding will last (but very comfortable to use in the meantime). Drip guards worked great. Seems well built and sturdy enough for paddling deep water, but not sure how it would handle hitting rocks or other hard objects (like river paddling).
customer_reviews.author: coastalrn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: This my second purchase of this paddle at this length. I'm short with a wide kayak, but when I bought my first paddle it was a short as recommended for my height. Go by the kayak size NOT your height! After using a short one this one at first is a little awkward, but now that I've adjusted I Love It! Strong enough to push off with and able to get nice strong strokes without bumping my hands or taking on any water!
customer_reviews.author: Jan D. Accardo

customer_reviews.title: inexpensive item that I wouldn't want to trust with my life
customer_reviews.text: I may be spoiled (I prefer Warner paddles), and this was to be my cheap backup paddle ... but bottom line, I just didn't trust it. The shaft is aluminum, and feels like some beach umbrellas I used to use -- the joint is a little loose. It's much heavier than I expected. It has the standard cheap/simple push button for connection that just doesn't feel reliable to me, and it only has 3 fixed settings for feathering, and they aren't my settings. And others complained that the blades weren't strong, and I realized I have to trust my backup paddle and that didn't help. I had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: EE Codewright

customer_reviews.title: Very good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: The kayak is 32 inches wide and the original paddles (220 cm) were too short. The new 96 inch paddles were just right and more of the blade was in the water. The only thing I would be concerned about is the short connection of the two pieces as to whether it would hold up under strong paddling. Right now, the paddle has only been used by two women. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Clark

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased two of these and absolutely love them!!! I cannot tell you how many people have used my paddles, plus myself almost on daily basis and they have held up for at least two years. Super lightweight, great color and very sturdy. My only complaint would be that the foam padding on the handles be embedded in the pole so they don’t slip out of place, but that is a very very minor issue.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Hayden

customer_reviews.title: After having these for a while on the river great. In the ocean on a rough day they are a bit too flimsy. Might want to go with
customer_reviews.text: We had ordered these paddles to replace 2 carlisle paddles that had washed away in a flood. As soon as we received them we were able to put them to the test. We liked them as well as the carlisles. The length was perfect. The grip was comfortable. We really liked the grips. All in all they are great. Good price for a good product. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Jayden Miller

customer_reviews.title: Only got one half of the paddle
customer_reviews.text: I bought an extra sea sense paddle since I really, really enjoy using these out on the water. The foam on the bar are great for comfort. I am a little disappointed that I ordered a second paddle, and only received one half of the two piece paddle. Will update review once this issue is straightened away.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Good but expected a bit more performance
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. Not the performance I expected and I, myself, find that it's no better than just the flat paddle we have. We also bought the shorter one and although it works fine....would have rather purchased the longer one. My kids who are ages 7 and 10 navigate fine with this paddle so I would say for the price, it's a good buy and does what is expected. Not too heavy which is a plus as well. Only gave it 4 out if five because it looks fancier and is curved so I thought performance would be better than the flat headed paddle we have.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Ventres

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended and I am happy with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Happy with this paddle. Took it out today for a 2 hour excursion in a fast moving and rocky river. Due to the crazy current I got stuck on a sand bar and had to use the paddle to push through it (sandy muck). It handled the heavy load with ease. The grips are great, I had no issue with blisters forming on my hands. The paddle is lightweight but sturdy. It easily clips together and does not have any wiggle to it. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: etrinity

customer_reviews.title: Excellent performance, excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: I can recommend this paddle. I purchased two of these for a two person - two kayak, three day kayak/camping trip. At times the water levels were quite low. I was extremely careful about how I placed weight on these paddles when having to push through the muck to get to deeper water. The majority of our paddling was on calm water but for good portions there was light chop from wind and motor boats. They performed well. I have no complaints, and the $30 price tag makes this an excellent purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Teo P.

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle, except...
customer_reviews.text: The grip cushions on this paddle were the one and only reason I bought this paddle. They are actually quite comfortable, but they are completely off-center. One cushion is about six inches from the paddle blade, and the other is more than a foot away, making it hard to center the paddle while still having the cushion in your grip. Tried sliding the grips on the shaft but they are too tight to move (that would be a great thing if they were evenly placed). Bottom line, I'm disappointed that the one reason I purchased it is the one thing I don't like about it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Good for flat water, not suitable for white water.
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is fine quality for flatwater padding as long as you aren't too aggressive with it. It is not however suitable for whitewater or rolling a kayak. I rolled twice with this paddle and when I was flipped in a rapid and tried to roll up the aluminum shaft of this paddle bent around my hand, made it impossible to roll, sent me for a swim and ended my trip. While this paddle is fine for relaxed paddle and flatwater it just wasn't made to deal with the stresses of aggressive paddling and whitewater.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem to be getting worse but the handle is not straight anymore
customer_reviews.text: I have used this paddle on 3 kayaking trips that have totaled about 14 hrs on the water and the paddle has worked well but has developed a slight bow in the middle. Doesn't seem to be getting worse but the handle is not straight anymore.
customer_reviews.author: bob

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle, light weight
customer_reviews.text: First kayak and first paddle. No complaints with the paddle. I’ve gone kayaking three times so far in pacific north west ocean (WA) and very happy with purchase. I’m 5foot so purchased the shorter paddle!
customer_reviews.author: Mallory

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my small duck boat and when I canoe alone on fairly calm water. Seem sturdy enough for my use, though I do not need to put a lot of pressure on it. Even with water deflecting bumpers one needs to be careful to prevent water from running off the paddle into the boat. A longer paddle would help, but I do not want that for duck hunting.
customer_reviews.author: RWS

customer_reviews.title: Great paddles and can be reduced in length.
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle, I’ve got three. I found it listed on a site reviewing the seven best paddles under $100. I’m glad I bought them. Some people are asking if they can be reduced to a smaller size - yes they can. The video is showing the 15-20 minute process.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good paddles, wish I got the ones that divided into 2 pieces
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these and they work great. Overall I have happy with the purchase, but in hindsight, I would have preferred the paddles that could be broken down into two pieces for easier transport and storage. It would be nice if we could just store the paddles right inside our kayaks, but they are too long for that, so they sit off to the side. The ones that break in half would have easily fit inside and would be safer there.
customer_reviews.author: heuvelho

customer_reviews.title: Great Paddles for the Money!
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars simply because of the sturdiness. These are great paddles for the money! Balanced, fast, easy to use on both of our Yaks (Journey 12 SS and Manta Ray 12). The only real issue is a tiny bit of movement where they go together, easily fixed with a little tape on the inside though! Used them 2 seasons and couldn't be happier for the money spent on them!
customer_reviews.author: WhiskerTamer

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle for the price
customer_reviews.text: This paddle is just what I expected. It has worked perfectly for kayaking in the Florida bay. I was concerned about the foam keeping my hands comfortable and it does. I’m sure there are paddles more sturdy for a higher price, but this one is perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Used one time. It broke in half and the river took it while on a long kayak trip. Thank goodness a friend had a spare. Not reliable!
customer_reviews.author: sharon moreau

customer_reviews.title: Good paddle. Good price.
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle for low dollars. This is the 2nd or 3rd one of these paddles I’ve bought. This particular one got damaged a little during shipping though. I had to straighten out the opening a little where the paddle halves are connected. Still used the paddle last night though.
customer_reviews.author: Hollie and Sean McDonald

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad paddle but needs a change on the grip
customer_reviews.text: Paddle seemed to function well overall. The foam that comes with it slides up and down the shaft when it gets wet. It does function find after that change. I upgraded to a fiberglass handle paddle to reduce the weight and kept this one to use as a backup if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Naduals

customer_reviews.title: Buy this if you want to get wet
customer_reviews.text: Buy this if you want to get wet. For some reason the design of this paddle makes it extra drippy. The stoppers on the shaft keep water from running down to your hands but it still flows off the paddle head and onto your legs much more than other paddles I own (I have 3 different types). I also felt that the center latch was a little loose and the allowable angle changes (left vs right) aren't displaced correctly. However, I do like the color, the padded grips and the width of the paddle blades.
customer_reviews.author: mister_nix

customer_reviews.title: IT'S BROWN, NOT GREEN!
customer_reviews.text: I have a green kayak so I bought this Military Green paddle since the picture clearly shows a neat looking green and black swirl color. It is NOT GREEN and barely black. It's actually a not so flattering BROWN color. See the pictures I attached.
customer_reviews.author: KAW

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: Its cheap and, well, its cheap....I appreciate them selling a paddle so cheap, but i had to send it back before ever putting it in the water cuz it felt more like a toy paddle than a real one....i thought that i would break it on my first kayak trip.
customer_reviews.author: rani solo

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, strong, comfortable. Very good value. Minor quibble was that they were difficult to separate into 2 pieces initially. After getting them apart I sprayed a little lithium grease on the ends and it seems to have solved the problem.
customer_reviews.author: Fizzie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Class 1 Lazy Lake Paddling
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for class one lakes. Light enough for ladies, tweens, those of us with arthritis, and beginners etc.Dont listen to the idiots who took this paddle on a class 3 or 4 river, not what it's made for. It's perfect for a nice sunny day of easy going paddling.
customer_reviews.author: Buyerinthehouse

customer_reviews.title: Foam grips need work!
customer_reviews.text: It's a paddle so it works in that regard. However, the foam grips are terrible. Once the water drips down the paddle, they slip and move. I have to find a solution to glue them or tape them to prevent this. If you need a cheap paddle it will work but just keep the grip issue in mind.
customer_reviews.author: Annette Protz

customer_reviews.title: Good for flatwater, but not made for anything else.
customer_reviews.text: I have to give this paddle three stars, and that is even pushing it. It was fine at first (only taken on the water once with my 10-ft kayak). The issue, was that when the water got a bit rough, the grips on the paddle started sliding up and down, making it nearly impossible to hold tight and gain traction. I was trying to save a few dollars with this paddle, and for stillwater it would be fine (shorter trips or recreational use). But, if you want to actually do some serious paddling, go for a nicer paddle. I should have.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley&Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Love this brand
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand! This is the third one I’ve ordered so that all our kayaks have the same paddles. Good grip. Well made for the price. I’d recommend
customer_reviews.author: JT1976

customer_reviews.title: Very light weight
customer_reviews.text: This is a lightweight and comfortable cushioned paddle for someone like me with smaller hands. It is suitable for slower moving water. I would hesitate to use it in a heavy current or swift whitewater rapids as it does flex a bit too much in more strenuous conditions.
customer_reviews.author: jewel e

customer_reviews.title: Ok paddle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this paddle as an upgrade to the one that came with my Sun Dolphin. Nice paddle but once I added padded grips to my original paddle, this is not markedly better. I got the shorter version, perhaps the longer one would have been better.
customer_reviews.author: MFP

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is the cheapest kayak paddle I own, and the heaviest. However it isn't much heavier than two paddles I have costing 3 times as much. Durability? Seems good enough for paddling the slow rivers and small lakes we go on.
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Snyder

customer_reviews.title: Great. Cheap. Functional
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to go along with our new kayak. It works as it should. Some reviews state that they break if used to push off. That's probably true but common sense should come to play somewhere. It is plastic and aluminum so yes it will break. But as far as just paddling goes. It works well.
customer_reviews.author: Southern handyman

customer_reviews.title: Quality Paddle
customer_reviews.text: I got my first kayak in April from a sporting goods store. Paddles from there were rather expensive, much more than what I needed as a beginner, so I opted for this one, & it was definitely a good choice. So far, the paddle has held up well & shows no signs of wear, even after repeatedly using it to dislodge myself from in between rocks in shallow areas. I love that the paddle breaks down into two parts, it makes for easy storage in my trunk when not in use. I look forward to many more kayak trips with this paddle!
customer_reviews.author: Allison

customer_reviews.title: Color is not like the seafoam green pictured
customer_reviews.text: I've used this paddle in the past on my sister's kayak. I was excited to order the green one pictured, but it's blue. Only the second picture is correct. The first greenish-blue picture should be removed. It’s pretty disappointing since I was trying to match my kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Just a girl

customer_reviews.title: Came with plastic drip ring
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 2 of these paddles, one came with rubber drip rings which stay in place, the second paddle came with plastic drip rings which do not stay in place. Overall these are average paddles.
customer_reviews.author: Mike H

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Wish they came in other colors but ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Wish they came in other colors but other than that, works wonderful. We bought an 84" but my wife said it's too short for her so i returned and ordered another one of these. She tried mine out and said its good to go. But the product is very well constructed and shipping was fast.
customer_reviews.author: Lanops

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional value
customer_reviews.text: The plastic paddles aren't super tough, but this is excellent quality for the price. If you want inexpensive paddles, these are a good choice. I highly doubt you would find something better built at the price point
customer_reviews.author: BennettTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t hold up
customer_reviews.text: The blade bends in the water when i paddle vigorously.
customer_reviews.author: In desperate need of coffee!

customer_reviews.title: Works well for a beginner like me.  Probably for advanced too.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my needs. I don't have a fancy kayak and I'm mostly just chugging along in calm(ish) waters. I like it better than the shorter paddles. If you're looking for a cheap upgrade over the shorter paddles, this works well. Nothing too fancy on it. My brother got a different paddle that had notches in the paddles for grabbing onto stuff like other kayaks. This one doesn't have that, but he doesn't use it much so its not an issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: Shlean

customer_reviews.title: Go Long!...and you will have a paddle you will love.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great paddle. My only regret is that I did not purchase the longer length...trashed the box before I used it with my kayak...and wish I could replace the one I bought. I just hold it for a guest that will be at the narrower front of the boat. This was my error, not the product. However, the quality of the product is really great. I advise you to GO LONG.
customer_reviews.author: G. G.

customer_reviews.title: Great Calm Water Paddle
customer_reviews.text: This paddle turned out to be a great little paddle for calm water kayaking. I say calm water, because it is a lighter weight version of a paddle needed for heavy paddling. Being lighter weight and not a heavy cup in the paddle, it is a joy to use on the lakes. I liked it so much I bought a second one as a back up. Great Price, Great delivery
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Good value for money
customer_reviews.text: First one arrived scratched up a bit. Feels durable and is lightweight. I went with the long one because I’m tall (6’2) and it is really long. Will see how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: druznak

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed - Paddle bent after only 2 uses
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed bought for my son to replace one that broke after 10 years of use - the paddle bent after 2 times out in the ocean - boys couldn't go out together after the paddle bent - sorry I bought this brand paddle because it didn't last more than to times out in the water.
customer_reviews.author: John Harrison

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, but....
customer_reviews.text: So far the paddle is working well, although I can see that the weak point will be the rivet that holds the blade onto the shaft. It will not be as sturdy as it could be if it had a better connection.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle for the price
customer_reviews.text: Paddle looks and feels nice. The handles are smaller than I would like though but my teen daughter liked it. Might be better for smaller statured paddlers. I believe these were around 1" diameter handles and my other paddles were 1.25". I prefer the larger diameter handles for paddling. Still for the price and quality it's a good paddle.
customer_reviews.author: uplandhawaii

customer_reviews.title: Warped paddle
customer_reviews.text: One of the paddles arrived with a warped fin, a result of manufacturing. I was given half my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Great paddle
customer_reviews.text: Did great on a 4 hour trip, I really like the soft gripping! Lightweight and sturdy, had to use several times to help push off of rocks. I wish they had other colors than black to help find it against the water.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful deal!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, but for sit-in kayak is better than the sit-on style! 5'5" people won't have a problem using this, but 5'10" might want a longer paddle for a sit-on to avoid getting too wet when paddling. :)
customer_reviews.author: J Mc

customer_reviews.title: Only received half a paddle for full price!!!!! F
customer_reviews.text: Only received half of my paddle. Very upset. Tried to contact seller for a refund for 2 months now with no reply. Not happy, and I'm not ever one to write a negative review, complain, nor ask for a refund, but with this at this stage I absolutely deserve one. Buyer beware! Paddles in theory are excellent quality, I'll give it that, and received correct color, but not only for a half of one, at full price!
customer_reviews.author: Laci Wicker

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap paddle
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, good looking paddle. Works as expected. No need to spend a ton of money on a "fancy" paddle. For the average kayaker, these paddles are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: Great single man canoe paddle
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle. Used for single man canoe. Used the shorter version last year and it dropped on me a lot. The longer one was just enough to keep the drip out over the water
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Bumgarner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Paddle
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle! We'd been using the cheap ones that came with a kayak we purchased. We ended up with blisters and water dripping everywhere. These are wonderful in comparison! They're sturdy, padded, and have drip guards. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Eccellent Paddle!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice paddle! Ideally, it would be larger in diameter and have less bow/flex, but as is works very well for my recreational use. My first was stolen by my wife, so I had to order another. A note on length: Standard paddle guidelines recommend length selection based on a person's height/reach. By these standards, I should use an 87"/220cm paddle. I find this length too short for use in my wider recreational kayak. Following my last trip with this 220cm paddle, my wife noticed my hands were bleeding from banging/scraping on the sides of the Kayak! This is eliminated with the longer 96"/240cm paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Quinn

customer_reviews.title: This paddle was an excellent choice for me
customer_reviews.text: This paddle was an excellent choice for me. It is light weight but very sturdy. The only complaint that I have is after only a couple hours of use one of the hand grips became loose. Not too big of a deal when it is dry, but when water gets under the grip it tends to slide. I will most likely silicone it or Gorilla glue it. Otherwise I recommend this paddle for a 5'-10" to 6'-0" person.
customer_reviews.author: bigMACpastor

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, but were getting stuck at joints when disassembling
customer_reviews.text: It was our first kayaking season, and these were our first paddles. We like them (but nothing to compare to). The only (minor) issue they were getting stuck at the joint toward the end of a 2-week camping trip. This could be a common problem with this aluminum alloy (?) tubes, but I am not sure. I'll try to add some geese for next season.
customer_reviews.author: Leonidych

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in quality
customer_reviews.text: As my wife says,"you buy cheap, you get cheap". Two major issues manifested in the very first use. First, the paddles both warped slightly and bent backward where the shaft end inserts into the paddle. Second and most important is that the shaft grips twist and slide which mean that your grip is constantly shifting. I suggest trying a paddle before making a purchase if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Alpaca Kramer

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD BUY!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this years ago, Very good for my use~ N/W Fl, gulf/bay INSHORE use. I dont go into rough water, or rapids etc, but for a leisurely outing fishing the shallow flats, these are great. I broke the original ones by trying to muscle out of a tight spot, but these have held up quite well for a couple of years now.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph D.

customer_reviews.title: Great budget paddle
customer_reviews.text: Solid bargain paddle have had it for over 4 years and it’s held up nicely I have no complaints with it. For the price it is at it is a great paddle I have a carlile and it is very similar in performance. It is a little heavier on longer paddles but that’s the trade off on price
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good
customer_reviews.text: Good length and cool color orange but the material is plastic and feels like if I banged it on rocks it will chip or break. I would prefer a more rubber feeling material for durability in the fiture but other than that they’re good for the price and worth what they are worth.
customer_reviews.author: Kassidy

customer_reviews.title: very good
customer_reviews.text: My sit in kayak has high side walls. The paddle that came with the kayak was short enough that I would scrape my hands on the sides. This paddle ends this problem.
customer_reviews.author: David Dailey

customer_reviews.title: 96 inches and large paddle-head... a winner!
customer_reviews.text: Serious paddlers need the 96 inch length and professional paddlehead size that these X-Treme kayak paddles. I just got back from a truly windy day on the river and I was very pleased that I had these new paddles with me.
customer_reviews.author: New Englander - Route 95

customer_reviews.title: efficient paddle
customer_reviews.text: the longer length and bigger paddle blades make paddling a kayak easy and efficient, demanding less energy than shorter paddles.
customer_reviews.author: JOY

customer_reviews.title: Looks good to me.
customer_reviews.text: Tell you the truth, I haven't eve gotten a chance to try my new paddle out yet. But I felt like writing a review anyway, because you just won't believe how beautiful this thing is -- elegant, really -- for such a low price. There must be a catch to it. It's wintertime, or early spring anyway, but really, I can't wait to get out there with this thing. That's the blackest black I've ever seen on a plastic sports object. Classy.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Katz

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Ordered 2nd one and happy. It has just enough flex to reduce stress on shoulder/elbow joints and has nice cushion for the grip (which WILL prevent blisters if you are just starting out)
customer_reviews.author: Michael G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazon needs to learn how to ship paddles
customer_reviews.text: Amazon needs to learn how to ship paddles it came bend where is joins together good thing I'm a mechanic and know how to fix things like that or is would have been unusable. The paddle is not bad is definitely not a $100 paddle but it's nice for $38
customer_reviews.author: Holly fredericks

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased.
customer_reviews.text: sturdy and well made. My old paddle gave up the ghost after many years, this is the replacement. I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Solid. Light. Locks in tight. Very little flex against a 11.5 Perception Tribe. I'm 6'0-180, and it works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: Nice and durable
customer_reviews.text: Nice and durable. The paddles feel a bit weak when I'm going for speed, almost as if they bend away from the water mid stroke.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap paddle
customer_reviews.text: Got this for easy transport. It snapped together and was nice and rigid. I read a ton of reviews and pulled the trigger on this one. Was happy with decision.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Small paddle surface
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice paddle. Sturdy. Lightweight. Easy to stow. Paddle surface is kind of small. If you need to correct quickly, the paddle makes you work for it. For just simple flat water surface, it performs well.
customer_reviews.author: drevans009

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle for the money. I don't think you could beat it for twice the price. A little heavy and the foam padding will rub blisters after long trips. Buy some paddling gloves with the money you save on the paddle.
customer_reviews.author: Almost F.

customer_reviews.title: Nice value
customer_reviews.text: We like these paddles as we own three of them. One disappointment is the foam pads tend to slowly slide up the tubing. I’ve needed to use a blow dryer to warm them up and slide them back down with much effort. Not a showstopper as they are very nice for the cost and seem durable in our two years of use.
customer_reviews.author: ISUMaddog

customer_reviews.title: Good price for beginner paddle.
customer_reviews.text: This was an ok paddle when I first started kayaking. After a season and using all sorts of other paddles I understand. I ended up with a carbon fiber paddle that costs over twice what I paid for this one. I still keep this with the extra gear just in case. If you're new to the sport and don't want to pay for something you may not like, this is a fine paddle. If this is not you're first rodeo, you're probably not even reading this review.
customer_reviews.author: DeltaDanny

customer_reviews.title: Good length
customer_reviews.text: Great paddle. I loved that the angle of the paddle was adjustable. Long enough to not get dropped on
customer_reviews.author: Helen Bryant

customer_reviews.title: Marvelous!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! High quality! Lightweight! Great handle grips! Easily compare to 179. Paddle I almost bought at Gander!
customer_reviews.author: Lemonjello

product_meta.title: SeaSense Kayak Paddle
product_meta.description: The Unfied Marine SeaSense X-Treme II Kayak Paddle is 96" in length and is manufactured with a fiberglass filled nylon blade making it x-tremely lightweight and durable. Each blade is Blue/White and is made of lightweight polypropylene and reinforced making it more efficient in the water. The shaft is lightweight aluminum with ergonomic foam grips for added comfort and strength. Comes in blue/white.
feature_bullets: Two piece construction for easy storage
Support ridge on paddle for added strength
Lightweight Aluminum Shaft and lighweight Fiberblass filled Nylon Palddle

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
